sentence: DICK's Sporting Goods Inc.DKS has once again guaranteed an increase in its shareholders' wealth with an annual rise in its dividend rate.
The news was the impetus behind the stock's 2.82% rise during yesterday's trade.
The company increased its quarterly dividend by Array0% to Array5.Array25 cents from Array3.75 cents per share.
This brings the company's annualized payout to 60.5 cents per share, reflecting a dividend yield of nearly Array.5% based on the increased dividend and the last closing stock price of $40.43.
The new dividend will be paid on Mar 3Array, 20Array6 to shareholders of record as of Mar ArrayArray, 20Array6.
The hike prior to this was seen on Feb Array8, 20Array5, when DICK's Sporting had raised its dividend by Array0% to Array3.75 cents from Array2.5 cents per share.
DICK's Sporting's strategy of paying a regular dividend and increasing the same reflects its commitment toward boosting the long-term value for shareholders.
This move also reveals the company's ability to increase earnings and cash flows in the long run, while highlighting its well-defined prospects.
Dividend hike is frequent among companies with a stable cash position and healthy cash flows.
Recently, dividend was also hiked by Array7% to 69 cents by Home Depot Inc. HD , 3% to 37 cents by GameStop Corp. GME and 7% to 30 cents by Archer Daniels Midland Company ADM .
A dividend hike not only enhances shareholder return but also raises the market value of the stock.
Through dividend increases, companies persuade investors to either buy or hold the scrip instead of selling them.
DICK's Sporting looks confident about its growth potential, suggesting enhanced value for its shareholders through continued dividend payouts.

However, DICK's Sporting currently carries a Zacks Rank #4 (Sell) as the company posted soft third-quarter fiscal 20Array5 results, wherein both the top and the bottom lines fell short of our estimates.
Further, comps came in way below the company's expectations owing to warm weather which led to sluggish trends, which continued into the fourth quarter.
Consequently, management lowered its projections for the full fiscal, thus raising concerns over the company's future results.
Nevertheless, we believe that DICK's Sporting's customer-oriented strategies and healthy financial status bode well.
